Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: plduffett
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights at end of March 2012 as part of a Eurostar package. Staff were so helpful, invaluable advice on where to go and when enabled us to get the best from a short stay. Room was spacious, fridge stocked with soft drinks, they even provided me with a UK adapter when mine failed. Breakfast was simple, but for the size of the hotel was very well presented. The free coffee machine in reception was just what we needed. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointingly poorly fitted rooms”
Reviews.Author: WeeJohnnie
Reviews.Content: Newly fitted out, I think, but the rooms were poorly furnished. There was no comfortable seating, for example, even though there was plenty of room. There was only a bath in my room - the shower spray could not really be used as there was no screen or curtain. The whole place felt like work in progress, at 230 euros a night without breakfast. But it is certainly handy, close to the Trocadero and the Champs Elysees and two metro stations within 100m

Reviews.Title: “Flooding in bathroom”
Reviews.Author: MelbS_LP
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately due to the lack of slope in the tiling, water from showering drips down the shower door onto the bathroom floor. This collects in the entrance corner and does not drain into the gutter in the middle. Have tried to soak that with lots of towels... But too much water!! The marble floor is very wet and slippery - very dangerous ! I think such problems in the rooms should be fixed first before being used due to the great risks of slipping

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: MelS3000
Reviews.Content: I checked in to stay for more than 3 days I was told the Tripadvisor coupon for free breakfast was not valid here( despite showing the reception the voucher from the Internet) but never mind - there is a nice bakery just outside where locals go with lovely baguettes and other times of bread! Also was told that bottled water was only provided once on the first day - that is skimping for a place like this! Seems to be very quiet too - only seen a handful of guests here, good if you need the space to be away from everyone

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, good location, poor service attitude, dated poorly-working room facilities. Four star prices but not four star.”
Reviews.Author: HoganTastic
Reviews.Content: I took the trouble to research this hotel and called to make the booking as we needed a family holiday following the death of our daughter exactly a year ago. I booked a suite for my wife and two sons requesting a street view or Eiffle Tower view and balcony. On arrival I was told no such thing even exists. So we have a view of a courtyard. And we were told that it is not possible to have four in a suite. But they would put an rxtra bed in for another €50. I even called the exact reservations executive and asked what is happening and he admitted to the mistake. He waived the extra charge, but we have still no bed. A stressful start to what was meant to be a respectful, restful weekend. With the wide choice in Paris I regret my selection, but I paid in advance (€400 per night)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maureennn
Reviews.Content: Great location and a stone's throw from the metro trocedero where the Eiffel tower is. Excellent service and rooms are nice and big for Paris standards. Had a junior suite and bathroom was clean with separate bathtub and shower stall. Very big bathroom. Comfortable from to back too after alot of walking n shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Dee159
Reviews.Content: We have just spent the weekend staying at this lovely hotel. It has the perfect location - being within walking distance of the Arc de Triomphe. It was clean and quiet and the staff were great. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service & Oustanding Location”
Reviews.Author: Alice S
Reviews.Content: It is at such a great location close to anywhere that you want to see in Paris. 10 minutes walking distance to Champs Elysees; very close to Palais de Chaillot, Eiffel Tower, and Arc de Triomphe.Very easy access to Metro. In spite of the old looking building, ınside is a different atmosphere for to experience it. Nicely designed room and great room service. Plenty of space inside the room that gives you good comfort feeling. I slept very nice and easy with this feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've stayed at in Paris”
Reviews.Author: snowman40
Reviews.Content: Over the last year I've stayed in a few hotels around the Arc De Triomphe area of Paris and when offered another night at the ok, but not astounding Cristal Champs Elyssees I found the Ascott which looked ok in the photos for the same price. I arrived pretty late after dinner, so I didn't get the full experience, but what I did get was truly excellent. The building is oldish, but everything inside is modern, stylish and new. Even at around 11 the reception was helpful and polite and I was quickly off to my room on the first floor. The floors are carpeted in deep, vivid scarlet carpet and there are some very funky plastic chairs in the corridors. My room was around a corner and through another door and I was thinking I was in for a tiny cupboard. The truth was quite the opposite. It was huge by Paris standards, with full length windows the whole length of the right side of the room with powered curtains floor to ceiling. There was a Bang and Olufsen TV and hi-fi in the room and the bed had 3 pillows across it! The bathroom (it was a bath, so no separate shower, but the unit in the bath had plenty of pressure) was fitted with wide sliding doors so you could luxuriate in the bath with the doors to the room open if you liked. There was plenty of space in cupboards and desks and the thick red carpet extended into the room. There was free wi-fi (often not the case in Paris I've found) too. The bed proved very comfy and I slept well. Next morning I had a pleasant buffet breakfast overlooking the smallish gym which looked plenty for a hotel stay - I believe there's a pool too, but this trip I had no chance to investigate either. Overall, this was a highly impressive hotel at (for Paris) a reasonable price. Next time I'm there I shall make a point of staying here again! Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great accommodation and service”
Reviews.Author: MichelleGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a European vacation where we stayed in numerous hotels and apartments. This hotel was our favourite. The location could not be surpassed, the rooms were large, modern and clean and the service was good. For example, after finding out that the air conditioning did not work in our first room, the management arranged for a mechanic to look at it within half an hour and then organised for an upgrade immediately once they found out that the problem could not be fixed in the short term. They also organised photocopying for us of several travel documents without an issue. This accommodation made our stay in Paris wonderful and we will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but I do not think it is worth the price I paid.”
Reviews.Author: jdanielca
Reviews.Content: Paid for a premier room 290 to 320 EUR BEFORE tax. They have recently changed to he Ascott brand and everything is in shambles. They cannot get the reservations right. Was supposed to be prepaid but they had not authorized my card by check in time. Had a harm time getting a room with a king sized bed, they have no idea which room is which and it took me 2 room changes and going up and down like an idiots, the 3rd room which was supposedly an upgrade was correct with a king sized bed. For that kind of money I would expect more. Everything is clean and in reasonable condition, some things may be dated like faucets and fittings etc. The room was huge but if what they said was anything to go by, I was getting an upgrade so if I got what I had paid for I would not be happy at all. Overall it is ok, expect for what I have mentioned, check in was a pain, you may not get what you think you paid for. If possible I would stay away but in a pinch it would do.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - Loved it”
Reviews.Author: turnonthesun
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location - a short walk to the Arc de Triomphe and the best view of the Eiffel Tower. Just 10 minutes on foot or a direct bus ride to Champs Elysees. Within easy reach to the metro. Fantastic room - large well appointed room. large bathroom, it was a such a pleasure to return to after a day out. Fantastic service - from the bell boy to the reception staff and housekeeping - prompt, attentive, efficient, friendly Absolutely perfect. 3rd trip to Paris, totally sold on the Ascott.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, superb room and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: claudia l
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for a weekend this august and found the ascott to be brilliant. the location was second to none and the quality was very satisfactory. the price was slightly on the high side but to be expected given then timing, we ate out every nite so cant comment on the food.....but i would definitely recommend the ascott for a romantic get away in central paris with a lot of class :)

HotelInfo.Name: Ascott Arc de Triomphe Paris
HotelInfo.Address: 81 Avenue Kleber | 16 Arr., 75016 Paris, France (Formerly Hotel Costes K)
